Class ProjectMethods

  • java.lang.Object
    • ProjectMethods

  • public class ProjectMethods
extends java.lang.Object
    This class groups all methods used to create and modify Project objects.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Nadia Botha

    • Method Detail

      • createNewProject

        public static Project createNewProject(java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetails,
                                       Project[] projectDetailsArray)
        This method enables the user to create a new Project object.

        The method requests the user to enter the values for Project fields (name, number, ERF Number, building type, total cost, total paid to date, deadline, project architect, project contractor, project customer) and creates a new Project object using the values entered.

        If no project name is provided, the name is automatically populated as the customer surname and building type. The method also ensures that the project number is unique by calling the isProjectNumberUnique, which prevents project number duplication.

        If the name and surname entered for a Person object (architect, contractor and customer) and the Person already exists, the field values for that Person does not need to entered again. It pulls the data from the person.txt file and saves the Person in the relevant Project field (projectArchitect, projectContractor, projectCustomer).

        Parameters:
        allPersonsDetails - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        projectDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        returns the new Project object with all the field values defined by the user.
        See Also:
        #isProjectNumberUnique(String, Project[]), #addExistingArchitectToProject(ArrayList, Scanner), #addExistingContractorToProject(ArrayList, Scanner), #addExistingCustomerToProject(ArrayList, Scanner), #Project(String, String, String, String, String, String, String, String, Person, Person, Person, String, String)

      • addExistingCustomerToProject

        private static Person addExistingCustomerToProject(java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetails,
                                                   java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method takes a customer name and surname entered and checks if the Person object already exists. If the person exists, the existing Person object is returned. If it does not exists, a new Person object is created.

        If the Person object exists, the index of the Person object in the Person ArrayList is determined and set equal to the Person object created in the method. If the Person does not exists, the createNewCustomer method is called, and the new Person object is added to the existing Person ArrayList and written to the text file.

        Parameters:
        allPersonsDetails - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        userInput - String input from the to provide the contractor name and surname.
        Returns:
        returns the Person object which is a project architect.
        See Also:
        #personIndexInPersonArray(ArrayList, String), #createNewCustomer(), #addPersonToArrayAndWriteToFile(ArrayList, Person)

      • addExistingContractorToProject

        private static Person addExistingContractorToProject(java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetails,
                                                     java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method takes a contractor name and surname entered and checks if the Person object already exists. If the person exists, the existing Person object is returned. If it does not exists, a new Person object is created.

        If the Person object exists, the index of the Person object in the Person ArrayList is determined and set equal to the Person object created in the method. If the Person does not exists, the createNewContractor methods is called, and the new Person object is added to the existing Person ArrayList and written to the text file.

        Parameters:
        allPersonsDetails - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        userInput - String input from the to provide the contractor name and surname.
        Returns:
        returns the Person object which is a project contractor.
        See Also:
        #personIndexInPersonArray(ArrayList, String), #createNewContractor(), #addPersonToArrayAndWriteToFile(ArrayList, Person)

      • addExistingArchitectToProject

        private static Person addExistingArchitectToProject(java.util.ArrayList<Person> allPersonsDetails,
                                                    java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method takes an architect name and surname entered and checks if the Person object already exists. If the person exists, the existing Person object is returned. If it does not exists, a new Person object is created.

        If the Person object exists, the index of the Person object in the Person ArrayList is determined and set equal to the Person object created in the method. If the Person does not exists, the createNewArchitect methods is called, and the new Person object is added to the existing Person ArrayList and written to the text file.

        Parameters:
        allPersonsDetails - Person ArrayList containing all the existing Person objects.
        userInput - String input from the to provide the contractor name and surname.
        Returns:
        returns the Person object which is a project architect.
        See Also:
        #personIndexInPersonArray(ArrayList, String), #createNewArchitect(), #addPersonToArrayAndWriteToFile(ArrayList, Person)

      • isProjectNumberUnique

        private static int isProjectNumberUnique(java.lang.String userDefinedProjectNumber,
                                         Project[] currentProjects)
        This method checks if a project number entered by the user is unique.

        The method loops through the existing projects, obtains the project numbers and compares the number entered with these existing numbers.

        Parameters:
        userDefinedProjectNumber - Project number entered by the user when creating a new project.
        currentProjects - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        returns and integer value which indicates if the number is unique. If the value returned is zero, the number is unique.

      • createProjectName

        private static java.lang.String createProjectName(java.lang.String userInputSurname,
                                                  java.lang.String userInputBuildingType)
        This method creates a project name from the string values of the project building type and customer surname.

        Parameters:
        userInputSurname - String that defines the customer surname
        userInputBuildingType - String that defines the project building type.
        Returns:
        returns the String value which concatenates the building type and customer surname strings.

      • addProjectToArrayAndWriteToFile

        public static void addProjectToArrayAndWriteToFile(Project[] currentProjectsArray,
                                                   Project newProject)
        This method adds the newly created Project object to the project array and writes the updated array to the Project text file.

        Method determines the number of existing projects, adds the project at the first empty array entry. Converts the Project array to a String array and writes the string array to the project text file by calling the convertProjectArrayToStringArray and writeUpdatedInfoToProjectTextFile methods.

        Parameters:
        currentProjectsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        newProject - New Project object which was previously created.
        See Also:
        #convertProjectArrayToStringArray(Project[]), #writeUpdatedInfoToProjectTextFile(String[]), ../projects.txt

      • findProjectByName

        private static int findProjectByName(java.lang.String userInputStringToFind,
                                     Project[] projectsDetailsArray)
        This method looks for a specific project name within the existing Project Array.

        The method will return the array index of the project name if it is found, otherwise -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        userInputStringToFind - Project name to look for in the Project array.
        projectsDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        returns an integer value which represents the index at which the project name was found or -1 if it was not found.
        See Also:
        #getProjectName()

      • findProjectByNumber

        private static int findProjectByNumber(java.lang.String userInputStringToFind,
                                       Project[] projectsDetailsArray)
        This method looks for a specific project number within the existing Project Array.

        The method will return the array index of the project number if it is found, otherwise -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        userInputStringToFind - Project number to look for in the Project array.
        projectsDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        returns an integer value which represents the index at which the project name was found or -1 if it was not found.
        See Also:
        #getProjectNumber()

      • findProjectByNameOrNumber

        private static int findProjectByNameOrNumber(java.lang.String userInputStringToFind,
                                             Project[] projectsDetailsArray)
        This method looks for a project within the existing projects array using either a project name or number provided by the user.

        The method first looks for the project number and then the project name, and returns the array index of where it was found. If neither is found a value of -1 is returned.

        Parameters:
        userInputStringToFind - String for the project name or number provided by the user.
        projectsDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        returns the index value of where the project name/number was found and -1 if neither was found.

      • finalizeProject

        public static Project[] finalizeProject(int indexToFinalize,
                                        Project[] allProjectDetailsArray)
        The method changes the completion date and status fields of a specific Project object.

        The method loops through the existing Project array and obtains the index of the Project object within the array. It then edits the specific Project completion date to the user defined value and the status to Finalized.

        Parameters:
        indexToFinalize - Index of the project to finalize within the Project Array.
        allProjectDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        the updated Project array, with the updated Project status and completion date.
        See Also:
        #setprojectCompletionDate(String), #setProjectStatus(String)

      • amountOutstandingToBePaid

        public static double amountOutstandingToBePaid(int indexToFinalize,
                                               Project[] allProjectDetailsArray)
        The method determines the amount that must still be paid for a specific project.

        The method converts the string total fee field value to a double. It also does it for the total paid to date. It then determines the amount to be paid by completing a subtraction calculation (total fee - total paid to date).

        Parameters:
        indexToFinalize - Index of the project to finalize within the Project Array.
        allProjectDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        returns the total amount still to be paid by the customer

      • createFinalizedProjectsArray

        private static Project[] createFinalizedProjectsArray(Project[] allProjectDetailsArray)
        This method creates an array which stores all of the finalized projects.

        It loops through the existing projects array and checks if the projectStatus field value is equal to Finalized.

        Parameters:
        allProjectDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        returns the Project array with all of the finalized projects.
        See Also:
        #getProjectStatus()

      • createIncompleteProjectsArray

        public static Project[] createIncompleteProjectsArray(Project[] allProjectDetailsArray)
        This method creates an array which stores all of the incomplete projects.

        It loops through the existing projects array and checks if the projectStatus field value is Incomplete..

        Parameters:
        allProjectDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        returns the Project array with Projects that have an incomplete status field value.
        See Also:
        #getProjectStatus()

      • createArrayListForProjectsOverdue

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Project> createArrayListForProjectsOverdue(Project[] allProjectDetailsArray)
        This method loops through all existing projects and places them in an array if they are overdue.

        The method compares the due date of each Project object with the current date. If the due date is earlier than the current, the project is overdue.

        Parameters:
        allProjectDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects.
        Returns:
        returns the Project array with Projects that have a due date earlier than the current date.
        See Also:
        #getProjectDeadline()

      • editExistingProjectDetails

        public static int editExistingProjectDetails(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                             int userChoice)
        This method enables the user to edit existing project details.

        This method reads the existing projects and persons from the text files, and saves it in separate arrays. The existing projects are then displayed to the user and requests the user to select a project(by number or name) to edit. The relevant project field is then edited and written back to the project and/or persons file. The user can edit the project total fee, total paid to date, deadline, architect contact details, contractor contact details and the customer contact details.

        Parameters:
        userInput - The string value for the project name or number that should be edited.
        userChoice - Integer representing what project parameter should be edited.
        Returns:
        returns the integer for the user's next choice on the main menu
        See Also:
        #readInputAndSavePersonArrayString(), #convertStringToPersonArray(ArrayList), #readInputAndSaveProjectArray(), #convertStringArrayListToProjectArray(ArrayList), #displayEditOptions(), #editTotalProjectFee(Scanner, Project[], int), #editProjectTotalPaid(Scanner, Project[], int), #editProjectDeadline(Scanner, Project[], int), #findProjectByNameOrNumber(String, Project[]), #editProjectArchitectContactDetails(Scanner, ArrayList, Project[], int), #editProjectContractorContactDetails(Scanner, ArrayList, Project[], int), #editProjectCustomerContactDetails(Scanner, ArrayList, Project[], int)

      • finalizeProjectAndWriteToFile

        public static int finalizeProjectAndWriteToFile(java.util.Scanner userInput)
        This method finalizes a project, saves it to the finalized projects array and writes it to the CompletedProjects.txt file.

        The method displays all the existing projects by name and number and requests the user to select a project to finalize. Determines the index array of the project by project name/number and then finalizes the project by calling the finalizeProject method. The project status is updated to Finalized, the updated project details are written to the projects.txt file, the outstanding account balance is determined, an invoice is displayed if there is an outstanding amount and all the Finalized projects are written to the CompltedProjects.txt file.

        Parameters:
        userInput - String value for the project name or number the user wants to finalize.
        Returns:
        returns the integer for the user's next choice on the main menu
        See Also:
        #findProjectByNameOrNumber(String, Project[]), #finalizeProject(int, Project[]), #amountOutstandingToBePaid(int, Project[]), #convertProjectArrayToStringArray(Project[]), #writeUpdatedInfoToProjectTextFile(String[]), ../CompletedProject.txt

      • editProjectDeadline

        private static int editProjectDeadline(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                       Project[] allProjectsDetailsArray,
                                       int indexToEdit)
        This method enables the user to edit a project deadline.

        The method displays the current project deadline, requests the user to enter the updated deadline. The Project object and Project Array is updated and written to the project.txt file.

        Parameters:
        userInput - String value for the project name or number the user wants to edit.
        allProjectsDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects..
        indexToEdit - Project Array index for which the deadline should be updated.
        Returns:
        returns the integer for the user's next choice on the main menu
        See Also:
        #getProjectDeadline(), #setDueDate(String), #convertProjectArrayToStringArray(Project[]), #writeUpdatedInfoToProjectTextFile(String[])

      • editProjectTotalPaid

        private static int editProjectTotalPaid(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                        Project[] allProjectsDetailsArray,
                                        int indexToEdit)
        This method enables the user to edit a project's total paid to date.

        The method displays the current project total paid, requests the user to enter the updated total paid. The Project object and Project Array is updated and written to the project.txt file.

        Parameters:
        userInput - String value for the project name or number the user wants to edit.
        allProjectsDetailsArray - Project Array containing all the details of existing projects..
        indexToEdit - Project Array index for which the deadline should be updated.
        Returns:
        returns the integer for the user's next choice on the main menu

      • editTotalProjectFee

        private static int editTotalProjectFee(java.util.Scanner userInput,
                                       Project[] allProjectsDetailsArray,
                                       int indexToEdit)
        This method enables the user to edit a project fee.

        The method displays the current project total fee, requests the user to enter the updated fee. The Project object and Project Array is updated and written to the project.txt file.

        Parameters:
        userInput - String value for the project name or number the user wants to edit.

        Returns:

      • createNewProjectAndWriteToFile

        public static int createNewProjectAndWriteToFile()
        This method creates a new project, adds it to the existing projects array and writes it to the project.txt file.

        This method calls the createNewProject method to create a new Project object . Then it calls the addProjectToArrayAndWriteToFile method to add the new project to the project array and write it to the projects.txt file.

        Returns:
        returns the integer for the user's next choice on the main menu
        See Also:
        #createNewProject(ArrayList, Project[]), #addProjectToArrayAndWriteToFile(Project[], Project), ../projects.txt
